borderRadius.$description: table.borderRadius — Table container border radius (4px). Slight rounding softens the table container. Only applies to outer border, not individual cells.

borderWidth.$description: table.borderWidth — Table border width (1px). Thin borders define cells without visual heaviness. Used for outer border and cell dividers.

lg.$description: table.cell.fontSize.lg — Large table font size (16px). Larger text for improved readability. Good for simple tables or accessibility needs.

md.$description: table.cell.fontSize.md — Medium table font size (14px). DEFAULT. Same as sm - keeps data compact while maintaining readability.

sm.$description: table.cell.fontSize.sm — Small table font size (14px). Standard data table text. Readable and space-efficient for most use cases.

xl.$description: table.cell.fontSize.xl — Extra large table font size (16px). Same as lg - body text size for maximum readability in spacious tables.

xs.$description: table.cell.fontSize.xs — Extra small table font size (12px). Compact text for dense data tables. Use for admin panels or data-heavy views.

lg.$description: table.cell.padding.horizontal.lg — Large horizontal cell padding (20px). Spacious tables with generous breathing room. Good for simple data with few columns.

md.$description: table.cell.padding.horizontal.md — Medium horizontal cell padding (16px). DEFAULT. Comfortable spacing for readable data. Recommended for most use cases.

sm.$description: table.cell.padding.horizontal.sm — Small horizontal cell padding (12px). Standard density for most data tables. Good balance of data and whitespace.

xl.$description: table.cell.padding.horizontal.xl — Extra large horizontal cell padding (32px). Very spacious tables for presentation or limited data. Maximum readability.

xs.$description: table.cell.padding.horizontal.xs — Extra small horizontal cell padding (10px). Dense tables for compact data display. Use when horizontal space is limited.

lg.$description: table.cell.padding.vertical.lg — Large vertical cell padding (12px). Taller rows for better touch targets and readability. Good for mobile or complex cell content.

md.$description: table.cell.padding.vertical.md — Medium vertical cell padding (8px). DEFAULT. Comfortable row height for general use. Good for scanning and selecting rows.

sm.$description: table.cell.padding.vertical.sm — Small vertical cell padding (6px). Standard density rows for most data tables. Efficient use of vertical space.

xl.$description: table.cell.padding.vertical.xl — Extra large vertical cell padding (16px). Maximum row height for spacious tables. Use for rich cell content or presentation.

xs.$description: table.cell.padding.vertical.xs — Extra small vertical cell padding (4px). Compact rows for dense data display like logs or detailed admin views.

fontSize.$description: table.header.fontSize — Table header font size (14px). Same as cell text but distinguished by weight and color. Consistent sizing aids alignment.

fontWeight.$description: table.header.fontWeight — Table header font weight (600). Semibold headers clearly distinguish column labels from data. Important for scanability.

duration.$description: table.transition.duration — Table row hover transition duration (100ms). Fast transition for responsive hover feedback on rows.
